1. Suppose that X is a discrete random variable having probability function $Pr(X = k) = ck^2$ for $k = 1,2,3$. Find $c, Pr(X â‰¤ 2), E[X]$, and $Var(X).$   

$$ Pr(X=1) + Pr(X=2) + Pr(X=3) = 1$$   
$$ 1^2c + 2^2c + 3^2c =1 $$   
$$ 1c + 4c + 9c = 1$$   
$$ 14c = 1 $$   
$$ c = 1/14 $$

```{r}
# c = 1/14 therefore:
PrX1 <- (1/14)*(1^2)
PrX1
PrX2 <- (1/14)*(2^2)
PrX2
PrX3 <- (1/14)*(3^2)
PrX3

# Pr(X â‰¤ 2)
PrX1 + PrX2

#Expected value
E_X <- PrX1 + (PrX2 * 2) + (PrX3 * 3)
E_X

# Var(X) = E[X^2] - (E[X])^2
var1 <- PrX1 + (PrX2 * 2^2) + (PrX3 * 3^2)
var2 <- (PrX1 + (PrX2 * 2) + (PrX3 * 3))^2
var1 - var2 
```

2. Suppose that $X$ is a continuous random variable having p.d.f. $f(x) = cx^2$ for $1 â‰¤ x â‰¤ 2$. Find $c, Pr(X â‰¥ 1), E[X],$ and $Var(X)$.     
   
$$ \int_ {1}^{2} cx^2 = 1 = \frac{1}{3}cx^3$$
$$ \frac{1}{3}c(2)^3 - \frac{1c(1)^3}{3} = 1$$
$$ \frac{8c}{3} - \frac{c}{3}$$
$$ c = \frac{3}{7}$$ 
   
Given this range, $Pr(x â‰¥ 1) = 1$
```{r}
# Expected value
# f(x) = cx^2
# E(X) = Integral of xf(x)dx over the whole domain of X.

f <- function(x){
     (3/7)*x^2
}

f2 <- function(x){x*f(x)}

integrate(f2,1,2)

# Var(X) = E[X^2] - (E[X])^2
f <- function(x){
     (3/7)*x^4
}
f3 <- function(x){x*f(x)}

integrate(f3,1,2)

(4.5) - ((1.6)^2)
```

5. A random variable X has the memoryless property if, for all $s,t > 0$,
$Pr(ğ‘‹ > ğ‘¡ + ğ‘ |ğ‘‹ > ğ‘¡) = Pr(ğ‘‹ > ğ‘ )$
Show that the exponential distribution has the memoryless property.   
pg. 193 DES - memoryless property:   
for all s â‰¥ 0 and t â‰¥ 0:    
$$ P(X > s + t | X > s) = \frac{P(X > s + t)}{P(X > s)}$$   
$$P(X > s + t | X > s) = \frac{e^{-\lambda(s+t)}}{e^{-\lambda s}} = e^{-\lambda t}$$
$$ = P(X>t) $$

5.39    
a. What is the distribution of the length of the linkage?   
```{r}
link_len <- function(){
  l <- rnorm(1, 60, sqrt(0.09)) + rnorm(1, 40, sqrt(0.05)) + rnorm(1, 50, sqrt(0.11))
  return(l)
}
# simulate 3000 
set.seed(200)
sim_link_len <- replicate(3000, link_len())
# summarize the simulation results
summary(sim_link_len)
# show variance
var(sim_link_len)
```
